page.title: 11BUILDINGS:FIRE STATION
page.content: {Potton}has had its{own fire engine} from about the{late eighteenth {century,}acquired after the disastrous {fire}of{1783.}There was another devastating{fire}in{1877}in which year the{Potton Fire Brigade}was formed. In June{1878}there was the{worst fire {in living memory in Bedfordshire}.It started in Potton in a barn occupied by Thomas Abbott. Before 1939 when the fire brigade lost its volunteer status under the Fire Brigade Act and was taken over by the Biggleswade District Council,{it was the only volunteer {force}for miles around and one of the oldest in the country. In 1946 Potton Fire Brigade was under threat of closure. However{today Potton still {does have its own unmanned fire {station.}Thirteen people from Potton work at the fire station on a part time basis.
